revised_title: Radiation Responses of Synchronous L5178Y S/S Cells and Their Significance in Radiobiology
tldr: The study investigates the radiation responses of synchronous L5178Y S/S cells and their significance in radiobiology. The authors found that the cell's survival rate varied depending on the phase of the cell cycle. Throughout the first half of the cycle, survival remained constant, then increased to a maximum before falling back to the initial level. The research provides insights into the relationship between cellular radiation responses, radiation damage, and repair mechanisms.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
